#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Order Alcohol
#Text=So , you 've just turned 21 and you 're finally allowed to order alcohol .
#Text=The only problem is , you 're not quite sure how .
#Text=Never fear , this article will give you all the tips you need to order alcohol and not look like a complete newcomer .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Find a place that sells alcohol .
#Text=You ca n't order alcohol if you show up to a place that does n't actually serve it .
#Text=To avoid having to drink orange juice , make sure the place that you 're going to sells alcohol .
#Text=The best places are bars , clubs and some restaurants .
#Text=They practically make all their money off of alcohol so you 'll be sure that they sell it .
#Text=Take a seat .
#Text=Before you run off to the bar , take a seat with your buddies .
#Text=Spend a few minutes deciding what you 're going to order .
#Text=If you and your friends are buying rounds and you 're paying first , you will have to order everyone 's drinks .
#Text=Make a mental or physical note of what they want .
#Text=If you 're not buying rounds , you 'll just have to buy your own drink .
#Text=Find the bar .
#Text=The bar is n't usually hard to miss .
#Text=It 's the most important part of a pub or club .
#Text=Make a quick scan of the building with your eyes to find it .
#Text=There could be speakers or TVs to attract people to it and there could be a long line or a cluster of people waiting to order .
#Text=If you 're having trouble , ask one of your friends to help you look for it .
#Text=Approach the bar .
#Text=Now 's the scary part ; making your way to the bar .
#Text=Do n't forget everyone 's drinks under the pressure .
#Text=If it helps , ask a friend to walk there with you .
#Text=It 's probably a good idea to go in twos , you do n't want to be hassled by a load of drunks on your first time , do you ?
#Text=Walk to the bar like you 'd walk anywhere else ; do n't try to do a gangster walk , you 're not cool yet .
#Text=When approaching the bar , have your money in your hand and keep your wallet safe and out of view .
#Text=Wait .
#Text=Now that you 're at the bar , you have to wait for the waiter to take your order .
#Text=If there are lots of people around , this could take some time .
#Text=Do n't shove your way to the front and do n't call the waiter over , just wait your turn .
#Text=If you 're alone , however , kindly call the waiter over if they have n't already seen you .
#Text=Never click your fingers for the waiter , it 's extremely rude and they probably wo n't serve you .
#Text=Just a polite " over here mate " will do .
#Text=Place your order .
#Text=Once the waiter 's come over to you , they 'll probably say something along the lines of " How can I help you ?

#Text=Just saying  three drinks " over and over will annoy them , be clear on what drink you want .

column1: #Text=Try to avoid changing your mind last minute , it can be hard if they 've already poured the drink and they might still charge you for it .
#Text=Pay .
#Text=After you 've got all of the drinks , the waiter will tell you the price .
#Text=If you 're in a pub , it could be quite expensive .
#Text=Do n't freak out , just pay the bill .
#Text=If you would like to , leave a small tip .
#Text=It does n't have to be a huge amount , £1 or two will do .
#Text=For example , if your drinks come up to £18.50 , give a £20 note , smile , and say " keep the change " .
#Text=Be sure to make it clear that you 're leaving a tip , not just forgetting your change .
#Text=If you would not like to tip the waiter , just wait for your change .
#Text=Enjoy your drinks .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Ask a friend to order first .
#Text=Watch what they say and how they say it .
#Text=When you go to order , say something similar .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Always drink responsibly , bad things can happen if you do n't .
#Text=Avoid getting into a drunken bar fight , you could get yourself killed .
